intro: Codonoboea lancifolia, commonly known as the lanceleaf codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
